items.title: Sigue en espanol AFSC will be hosting another vigil in February...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Sigue en espanol

AFSC will be hosting another vigil in February with the theme- Love Knows No Borders, No Walls

For the 12th year in a row, AFSC will deliver handmade valentines to detention center detainees and day laborers. People who could use extra love right now. We consider this a meditation. Make something beautiful for someone separated from loved ones, separated by borders and distance or by walls. We assert that our Love knows No Borders, No Walls.

...

Don’t miss the Virtual Vigil on Monday, February 1st, 6:00-7:00 pm right here or on our page.
*********************
AFSC llevará a cabo otra vigilia en febrero con el tema: El amor no conoce fronteras, sin muros.

Por 12 años consecutivo, AFSC entregará tarjetas de San Valentín hechas a mano a los detenidos y jornaleros del centro de detención. Personas que podrían usar amor extra ahora mismo. Consideramos esto como una meditación. Haga algo hermoso para alguien separado de sus seres queridos, separado por los bordes y la distancia o por las paredes. Afirmamos que nuestro amor no conoce fronteras, ni muros.

No se pierda la Vigilia Virtual el lunes 1 de febrero, de 6:00 a 7:00 p.m. Se presenta aqui en Facebook.

See More

MON, FEB 1 AT 6:00 PM MST

Love Knows No Borders, No Walls Virtual Vigil

Causes · 126 people

items.title: Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity Meals program. She arrived to the U.S. when she was just five years old, and through DACA she’s been able to pursue higher education, work for Denver Public Schools as a family liaison, and have a family of her own. She’s now applying for her residency, which is an incredibly expensive process, so she’s selling enchiladas this weekend to help raise money to cover the costs. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co. Pickup will be in Denver this weekend, and money can be sent via Venmo to @/tania-baez-30. Place in Denver for pick up 1400 N Lafayette St Denver Co 80218 ready 1 pm

items.title: Panel y discusión:  -----------------------  31 de enero de...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Panel y discusión:
-----------------------

31 de enero de 2021, 10 a.m.-11: 30 a.m. PST / 1 p.m.-2: 30 p.m. EST

...

Los inmigrantes en los EE. UU. Se enfrentan a una realidad más dura que nunca bajo la pandemia de COVID-19. Todos los días, los trabajadores indocumentados y sus familias enfrentan no solo la amenaza constante de ICE y la violencia policial, sino también condiciones de trabajo cada vez más inseguras y de explotación, vivienda insegura, exclusión de los servicios básicos de salud y acceso casi imposible a los beneficios de lo que restos del estado de bienestar. ¡Únase a nosotros para discutir estas realidades y luchas de costa a costa!

Escucharemos a los panelistas involucrados en esta lucha de Pangea, Corriente Obrera, Cosecha, Workers 'Voice-La Voz de los Trabajadores y CST-México. Luego, tendremos tiempo para una discusión abierta.

*** El evento está en español con traducción al inglés.

**** Regístrese aquí: https://bit.ly/3nsqAjV
____________________________________________

La lucha por los derechos de los inmigrantes:
bajo el covid y la nueva administración Biden

Panel y discusión:
------------------

31 de enero de 2021. 10:00 am Hora del Pacifico

En Estados Unidos, los inmigrantes se enfrentan a realidades cada vez más duras bajo la pandemia de COVID-19. Día tras día, los trabajadores indocumentados y sus familias se enfrentan no sólo a la amenaza constante de la migra, la violencia policial y el encarcelamiento, sino también a peligrosas condiciones de trabajo, a la explotación, a la precariedad en la vivienda, la exclusión de los servicios médicos más básicos, y casi imposible acceso a los beneficios de lo poco que queda del estado de bienestar. ¡Venga a debatir estas realidades y nuestras luchas con nosotros!

*** Evento en español con traducción al inglés

**** Registrarse aqui: https://bit.ly/3nsqAjV

See More

SUN, JAN 31

The FIGHT for Immigrant Rights/ La lucha por los derechos de los inmigrantes

Online EventCauses · 123 people

items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"An estimated 19,000 [asylum seekers] have been reported dead or missing in the Mediterranean Sea since 2014 as they attempt the treacherous boat journey from Libya to Europe, fleeing war, persecution and poverty.

Since its foundation in 2015, Spanish NGO Open Arms has rescued over 60,000 refugees. But nothing prepared it for the events that unfolded on November 1, 2020."

items.title: "When Westword asked GEO Group about Biden's January...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"When Westword asked GEO Group about Biden's January 26 executive order calling for the Department of Justice to phase out its use of private prisons, Pablo Paez, a vice president for the company, said that the order is a "solution in search of a problem" and that GEO Group has run "newer and more modern" facilities for the Bureau of Prisons for more than three decades.

Paez did not respond when asked whether GEO Group was concerned about a possible shift away from private prisons for immigrant detention; ICE declined to comment."

"Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard."

westword.com

Crow Wants Biden to Stop Using Private Prisons for Immigrant Detention

"Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard.""Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard."

items.title: "Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived and worked in the country without legal status until 2011, when a car crash put him on federal authorities’ radars. Ever since, he’s been fighting for a pathway to remain in the country and avoid deportation back to El Salvador.

It’s not uncommon for cases like his to take the better part of a decade. As people navigate the country’s complicated, constantly changing legal landscape, they’re usually granted permission to... work. Blanco was holding down a job at a restaurant until COVID-19 restrictions meant his hours whittled away to nothing. Though taxes from his wages paid into Colorado’s unemployment insurance system, his status meant he wasn’t allowed to benefit from that program. His family was also ineligible for the congressional stimulus checks issued last year.

The money he and Martinez make from the food they sell helps them feed their two children and stay engaged in Blanco’s case."

See MorePresident Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

denverite.com

Undocumented Denverites can't file for unemployment, so families got creative to keep the bills paid

President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

items.title: Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely hailed as “the end of private prisons.” I saw major media organizations and leading political leaders literally tweet that Biden just issued an executive order “ending private prisons.”⁣
⁣
Except NO SUCH THING happened. ⁣
⁣
The overwhelming majority of private prisons are state-based. 100% of those private prisons will continue. ⁣...
⁣
But not only will 100% of city, county, and state based private prisons continue to operate, the majority of federal private prisons and detention centers, which are immigration detention centers, will continue as well. Biden’s executive order didn’t cover any of those. ⁣
⁣
About 8% of all incarcerated people are housed in private prisons. Most of those people will remain in private prisons. ⁣
⁣
92% of all incarcerated people are in public facilities. Worse, Biden’s executive order appears to impact only a microscopic amount of the already tiny percentage of people held in private prisons. ⁣
⁣
One expert today told me that Biden’s announcement would impact such a tiny percentage of people that he didn’t actually have a number for it – because it’s less than half of a percent. And they are simply going to be moved to other prisons - not released. ⁣
⁣
This is performative change. It’s more than nothing, but at the same time somewhere in the ballpark of a half step above nothing. To actually confront this problem, it’s going to take a lot of more than this. ⁣
⁣
On the list of things that could be done, this doesn’t crack the top 25. It’s performative. Fluff. Nothing changes.

See More

items.title: It’s our last sale of the month! Two families will be working...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

It’s our last sale of the month! Two families will be working together to make burritos, and the money will go toward an emergency fund, rather than the families cooking. The growth of this fund is incredibly important to the families who lead Sanctuary4All because it provides security in case anyone is unexpectedly detained and needs money quickly for legal representation. You can order a burrito at solidaritymeals.paperform.co
